article_node.title: US to Revoke China Waivers for South Korean Chip Firms
article_node.summary: The U.S. Commerce Department announced it will revoke the waivers that allowed Samsung Electronics and SK Hynix to ship chip equipment from China without a license, tightening export controls on semiconductor manufacturing. The move comes amid broader U.S. efforts to curb China’s chip supply chain and is expected to impact the global semiconductor market. Meanwhile, Dell and Marvell shares fell after earnings disappointments, and U.S. regulators are advancing a crypto‑friendly agenda, with the SEC Commissioner outlining new blockchain initiatives.
